issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
EC: "removePolicy" is not working for built-in/system Erasure Code policies

- Check the existing built-in EC policies with command "hdfs ec -listPolicies"
- try to remove any of the EC policies,it will throw error message as "RemoteException: System erasure coding policy RS-3-2-1024k cannot be removed"
- add user-defined EC policies 
- Try to remove any user-defined policy,it will be removed successfully
- But in help option it is specified as :
 vm1:/opt/client/install/hadoop/namenode/bin> ./hdfs ec -help removePolicy
[-removePolicy -policy <policy>]

Remove an erasure coding policy.
<policy> The name of the erasure coding policy
vm1:/opt/client/install/hadoop/namenode/bin>

Actual result :-
 hdfs ec -removePolicy not working for built-in/system EC policies ,where as usage description 
 provided as "Remove an erasure coding policy".throwing exception as : "RemoteException: System erasure coding policy RS-3-2-1024k cannot be removed"

Expected output : Either EC "removePolicy" option should be applicable for all type of EC policies 
 Or it has to be specified in usage that EC "removePolicy" will be applicable to remove
 only user-defined EC policies, not applicable for system EC coding policies.
fields.summary: EC: "removePolicy" is not working for built-in/system Erasure Code policies

comments.body:
I don't quite recall the design here (although I believe I reviewed the patch) but IIRC we decided to not allow system built-in EC policies to be removed.

We should probably expand the EC doc and command line message to include this.
[~Sammi] [~xiaochen]

Thanks for the report [~SouryakantaDwivedy] and [~jojochuang] for the comment.

Yes add and remove should be only for custom EC policies. We should do an documentation / message update here.

[~SouryakantaDwivedy] thanks reporting this issue.

[~jojochuang] and [~xiaochen] thanks for your inputs.

 

Uploaded patch.Kindly review..
Thanks for the patch [~ayushtkn].As [~xiaochen] sugggested in comments you can update the patch for usage info of EC "addPolicies" also.
Oh,Yes.I missed that..Now I updated for "addPolicies" also.

Patch looks good. Would you please also update TestErasureCodingCLI? This test verifies the output string of ec commands and it failed as a result of the message change.

bq. Patch looks good. Would you please also update TestErasureCodingCLI? This test verifies the output string of ec commands and it failed as a result of the message change.
Thanks for the review.
Updated the patch with fix for TestErasureCodingCLI and also added assertion for removePolicy.

Thanks [~ayushtkn] for the fix, appreciate on adding the coverage for removePolicy!

I'm +1 pending jenkins and the following nit:
- HDFSErasureCoding.md: {{Remove an User Defined erasure coding policy.}} should be lower case for consistency. (e.g. {{Remove an user defined erasure coding policy.}})

bq. HDFSErasureCoding.md: Remove an User Defined erasure coding policy. should be lower case for consistency. (e.g. Remove an user defined erasure coding policy.)
Handled this nit before commit. Test failure and asflicense errors are unrelated to this change.
